description: From Middle English potell, potel, from Old French potel, diminutive of pot; see more at pot.

entries.meaning: (archaic) A former unit of volume, equivalent to half a gallon, used for liquids and corn; a pot or drinking vessel of around this size.
(New Zealand) A watertight receptacle, typically for potato chips, yoghurt or other foodstuffs.
(archaic) A small pot or other receptacle, e.g. for strawberries.
examples: Strawberry pottles are often half cabbage leaves, a few tempting strawberries being displayed on the top of the pottle.
